Gabriel Rivera: Game Designer

My name is Gabriel Rivera, I am a recent graduate from the University of California: Santa Cruz with a BA in Game Design with a specialty in writing and narrative design.

Find Out More

Goals

My work focuses primarily on storytelling, either it being through an interactive text-based story or through a different game mediums. As a game designer and writer, my main goal is to create an escape for people. For them to experience enjoyment, love, and entertainment no matter how big or small the scope is.

Get Started!

Resume

Resume link
3d-Isometric RPG
Ensol

Ensol is a 3D isometric narrative RPG set in a solarpunk world where the real enemies are the ones that want the best for you. Encounter enemies, upgrade your weapons, and ask your robot cat what is going on?!

Adventure Campaign
Casa de la Marina
An adventure campaign designed for the ttrpg game: Kids on Bikes. This adventure takes place in a larger supernatural mystery town based on Santa Cruz.
Adventure Campaign
Casa de la Marina
An adventure campaign designed for the ttrpg game: Kids on Bikes. This adventure takes place in a larger supernatural mystery town based on Santa Cruz.
Interactive Game
Escape the Lab

A Sci-Fi interactive story game made using twine. This game comes with two major branching paths and nine distinct endings. How will you survive this the chaotic world you find yourself in?

Interactive Story
Are you alone?
A horror interactive story game using custom code that I have adapted from my professor. The game has multiple unique endings depening on what the user does and does not do.
Card Game
Cat Card Game
An in development card game based on the book series "Warrior Cats". A 1v1 card game in which the goal of the game is to win 3 short battles by reducing the enemy resources to 0. Digitial implementation in the works.
Design Exercise
Finalize Me: Queer Stories
A character design exercise using twine. In this game, you're able to ask queer characters about themselves before finalize their appearance yourself. Meant for queer people and character designers.
Many more to come!
